headline.main: In Game 1, Heat's James And Wade Are Too Good

docs.snippet: LeBron James had 32 points and 13 rebounds, and Dwyane Wade had 22 points and 7 assists as Miami took Game 1 of the Eastern Conference finals from visiting Boston....
docs.abstract: Miami Heat defeat Boston Celtics, 93-79, to take 1-0 lead in NBA Eastern Conference finals. Photo (M)0
docs.lead_paragraph: MIAMI -- Five summers ago, the Boston Celtics created a new model for title contention. Two summers ago, the Miami Heat duplicated it, with parts that were newer, shinier , springier, and guaranteed that the Eastern Conference playoffs would never lack for epic star power. The rivalry still rages, at least for week or so, and beyond that no one knows. The Celtics are still riding Paul Pierce, Ray Allen and Kevin Garnett, through age and injuries and diminishing returns, against the threat of an uncertain future and the greater threat of the Heat's sheer athleticism.

headline.main: Indian Premier League Saves Best Cricket for Title Game

docs.snippet: A relative unknown led the Kolkata Knight Riders to an upset victory over the two-time defending champion, Chennai, in the final....
docs.lead_paragraph: Manvinder Singh Bisla entered the Indian Premier League final as probably the least heralded of the 22 players who took part. By the time it was over, he was a lot more famous -- and potentially in line for a much bigger payday next season. Few expected him to take part in the championship match Sunday, but on Saturday night the Kolkata Knight Riders made the surprise decision to pick Bisla over the hard-hitting New Zealander, Brendon McCullum.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  HEINES, MURIEL R

docs.snippet: HEINES--Muriel R, 96, a lifelong Brooklyn resident died on Friday, May 25, 2012. Survivors include her beloved daughter, Molly K. Heines and her husband Thomas J. Moloney; and her loving family, Robin Moloney and Richard Cook, and their children, ...
docs.lead_paragraph: HEINES--Muriel R, 96, a lifelong Brooklyn resident died on Friday, May 25, 2012. Survivors include her beloved daughter, Molly K. Heines and her husband Thomas J. Moloney; and her loving family, Robin Moloney and Richard Cook, and their children, Tommy and Patrick Cook. Reposing on Sunday and Monday from 2-5pm and 7-9pm at Greenwich Village Funeral Home, 199 Bleecker Street. Mass on Tuesday at 10am at St. Joseph's Church, Greenwich Village. Interment in Holy Cross Cemetery, Brooklyn. In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions may be made to St. Joseph's Church, 371 Sixth Avenue, NY, NY 10014 or Battery Dance Company, 380 Broadway, 5th Floor, NY, NY 10013. green wichvillagefuneralhome.com

headline.main: Mets Are Short-Handed At Shortstop After Loss

docs.snippet: The Phillies won for the fifth time in six games, and the Mets’ Justin Turner could be headed to the disabled list with a sprained ankle, thinning an already stretched infield....
docs.abstract: Philadelphia Phillies defeat New York Mets, 8-4. (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: For the Mets, the past week had been among their best of the season, featuring back-to-back shutout performances by Johan Santana and R. A. Dickey and a string of five victories in six games. But a sunny, hot Memorial Day turned ominous when they lost to the Philadelphia Phillies, 8-4, on Monday at Citi Field and one of the team's spark plugs, the utility infielder Justin Turner, sprained his right ankle. Turner will probably be sidelined for weeks.

headline.main: Given a Fourth Strike, Aviles Spurs Boston

docs.snippet: After an umpire’s mistake, Mike Aviles lined a single to center that started a three-run surge in the second inning to give the Red Sox the lead for good in a 7-4 win over the Tigers....
docs.abstract: MLB Roundup; Boston Red Sox beat Detroit Tigers, 7-4; other MLB scores noted. Photos (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: After an umpire's mistake on what should have been the third strike, Mike Aviles lined a single to center that started a three-run surge in the second inning. That gave the Boston Red Sox the lead for good in a 7-4 victory over the visiting Detroit Tigers on Monday. ''I got another swing, got another hit, one run scored there, and we ended up scoring two more right after that,'' Aviles said. ''It helped us out, gave us momentum, and we kept rolling from there.''

headline.main: Mubarak Aide's Offices Burn During Protests of His Runoff Candidacy

docs.snippet: A fire broke out at the presidential campaign headquarters of Ahmed Shafik, Hosni Mubarak’s last prime minister, after he had been confirmed as one of two candidates for the runoff election....
docs.abstract: Presidential campaign headquarters of Hosni Mubarak's last prime minister, Ahmed Shafik, bursts into flames as demonstrators march in the streets protesting his confirmation as one of two candidates to advance to Egypt's runoff election. (M)/

byline.original: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and LIAM STACK; Mayy El Sheikh contributed reporting

docs.lead_paragraph: CAIRO -- The presidential campaign headquarters of Hosni Mubarak's last prime minister burst into flames Monday night as demonstrators marched in the streets protesting that former official's confirmation as one of two candidates to advance to Egypt's runoff election. If found to be arson, the fire would be the most destructive act of election-related violence since Mr. Mubarak's ouster as president. Interior Ministry officials said they had not yet determined the exact cause of the fire, although they arrested one person inside the building. They did not disclose the person's identity or possible motives.

headline.main: Canadian Official Offers Bill to End Railway Strike

docs.snippet: Lisa Raitt, Canada’s labor minister, said she acted to prevent more economic damage from the six-day walkout....
docs.abstract: Canada's labor minister Lisa Raitt introduces legislation to end a strike by about 4,800 workers at the Canadian Pacific Railway; says move is necessary to prevent more economic damage from the six-day walkout. Photo (M)2
docs.lead_paragraph: OTTAWA -- Canada's labor minister introduced legislation on Monday to end a strike by about 4,800 workers at the Canadian Pacific Railway. Lisa Raitt, the minister, said the move was necessary to prevent more economic damage from the six-day walkout. ''Our government is really concerned that a disruption at Canadian Pacific will damage Canada's fragile economic recovery,'' she said outside of the House of Commons. Ms. Raitt added that she estimated the strike could cost the Canadian economy about $500 million a week, although neither she nor the government offered specifics about how that amount had been calculated.
